drupalNodeEvent.title: Emory – Nanjing International Symposium on Literature, Culture, and Language Research and Practice

field_speakers.processed:
• Maria Franca Sibau, REALC, Emory University (Panel 1)
  • Guangchen Chen, REALC, Emory University (Panel 2)
  • Hong Li, REALC, Emory University (Panel 3)
  • Heather Boldt, Laney Graduate School, Emory University (Panel 4)

field_organizers.processed:
• Emory University Department of Russian and East Asian Languages and Cultures
  • Emory Office of Global Strategy and Initiatives

field_description.processed:
Emory University and Nanjing University are proud to present an academic symposium exploring topics in literature, culture, and language research and practice. This inaugural event jointly organized by our two institutions and hosted by Emory University will provide the opportunity to share new and ongoing research and pedagogical activities, showcase collaborative projects, discover intersections between our diverse disciplines and institutions, and establish a venue for continued collaboration.

The symposium will be held via Zoom (view registration link above) on March 14–15, 2022 from 8:00 pm-10:30 pm Eastern Standard Time/ March 15–16, 2022, from 8:00 am to 10:30 am China Standard Time.
